xxl.core.indexStructures

Class HilbertRTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.indexStructures.Tree
      • xxl.core.indexStructures.BPlusTree
        • xxl.core.indexStructures.HilbertRTree

  • public class HilbertRTree
extends BPlusTree
    HilbertRTree with R*tree split(1-2 split policy) and BPlusTree merge strategies. This Implementation is based on BPlusTree. The indexEntries of BPlusTree were extended to manage MBBs. To use spatial semantic of the tree queries run queryOR(Rectangle, int) For a detailed discussion see Ibrahim Kamel, Christos Faloutsos : "Hilbert R-tree: An Improved R-tree Using Fractals" Proceedings of the 20th VLDB Conference Sanitago, Chile, 1994
    See Also:
    Tree, BPlusTree, ORTree, RTree

                               Function createORSeparator,
                               Function createKeyRange)
        Initializes the HilbertRTree.
        Parameters:
        computeSFCurveValue - Function which computes SpaceFillingCurve value of the middle point of the normalized dataMBR
        getMBR - function which computes the MBR of the dataObject
        container - container of the tree
        keyConverter - converter for keys of the dataObjects
        dataConverter -
        createORSeparator - a factory Function to create (Overlaping)Separators
        createKeyRange - a factory Function to create (Overlaping)KeyRanges
        Returns:
        the initialized HilbertRTree itself

        dataConverter -

                                getDescriptor.invoke(entry)

      • insert

        protected void insert(Object data,
                      Descriptor descriptor,
                      int targetLevel)
        Description copied from class: BPlusTree
        Inserts an object into a given level of the tree. If level > 0 data has to be an IndexEntry (this only makes sense for trees whose index nodes support Node.grow()).
        Overrides:
        insert in class BPlusTree
        Parameters:
        data - the data to insert
        descriptor - is used to find the node into which data must be inserted
        targetLevel - is the tree-level into which data has to be inserted (targetLevel==0 means insert into the suitable leaf node)

      • queryOR

        public Cursor queryOR(Rectangle queryRectangle,
                      int targetLevel)
        Original Algorithm from ORTree The cursor does not support remove operations. To remove the object from the tree call BPlusTree.remove(Object)
        Parameters:
        queryDescriptor -
        targetLevel -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        Tree.query()

      • queryOR

        public Cursor queryOR(Rectangle queryDescriptor)
        This method is an implementation of an efficient querying algorithm. The result is a lazy cursor pointing to all leaf entries whose descriptors overlap with the given queryDescriptor.
        Parameters:
        queryDescriptor - describes the query in terms of a descriptor
        Returns:
        a lazy Cursor pointing to all response objects
        See Also:
        BPlusTree.query(Descriptor, int)

      • queryOR

        public Cursor queryOR(int level)
        This method executes a query using the rootDescriptor on a given level. That means, that the response consists of all entries of the given level.
        Parameters:
        level - the target level of the query
        Returns:
        a lazy Cursor pointing to all response objects

      • queryOR

        public Cursor queryOR()
        This method executes a query using the rootDescriptor on the leaf level. That means, that the response consists of all leaf entries (i.e. data objects) stored in the tree.
        Returns:
        a lazy Cursor pointing to all response objects
